experience: You and Malerie both know Eric Keosky-Smith, Trish Bear, and 100 others
Successful business evolution is not slow and steady like Darwin's observation of evolution.
A business can transform overnight, because it is not a biological specimen.
We can talk all day about how we are going to disrupt consumer behavior and change the world, but what are you doing to disrupt your own behavior?
Are you successful at shaking things up for yourself?
If you wait until you gain the expertise in doing something BEFORE you start doing it, then you may be setting yourself up to miss the open windows of opportunity available to you.
Start making decisions that are different than what you would have made yesterday. Still make SMART decisions, but don't always stick to just making the safe ones.

summary: I am a born Creative!  I live, breathe and dream about art, design, patterns, nature, anything botanical and I love marketing and advertising.  While my strengths are in Ideation, Strategy, Analytics, Coaching, Sales, Event Planning, Team Building, Recruiting and Management, I was born with a passion for both math and art and although I'm thankful I didn't follow my one dream to become a math teacher, I'm still on the path to including that and art in every part of my career.  As a Fine Arts major with a concentration in Glass Art: Stained Glass, Neon and Glassblowing, I couldn't figure out how I was going to make a living as a glass blower on the east coast, so I spent some time working at Disney World and fell in love with guest service which prompted me to change my major and graduate with a BS focused in Hospitality Management and Business from The Ohio State University.  Now I am in the desert, living out my dreams, working with the most incredible clients and people in the creative, marketing and advertising industry, while still always pursuing my side hustle as a true artist!
